name: frustrate
content:
frustrate verb [T]
(DISCOURAGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make someone feel annoyed or less confident because they cannot achieve what they want: It frustrates me that I'm not able to put any of my ideas into practice.

(PREVENT)
to prevent the plans or efforts of someone or something from being achieved: The continuing civil war is frustrating the efforts of relief agencies.

frustrate verb [T]
(ANNOY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to annoy someone or cause someone to be disappointed or discouraged: People are frustrated with the politicians. Customer service is important, so businesses can’t afford to frustrate customers.
frustrate verb [T]
(BLOCK)
to block something from being achieved; prevent the success of a plan or effort: For now there are enough votes to frustrate the administration on issue after issue.
